summary: Front-end only draft for a concise, sleek student exam registration website with multiple visual design variations (dark themes and color-theory-based versions).
architectural_notes: Front-end only UI draft; no backend functionality required.
Provide multiple visual design variations (dark-only themes and color-theory-based themes).

existing_features.title: Create a concise front-end draft (no backend integration) for a student exam registration website with a minimal number of screens and clear user flow: Landing/Start, Exam Selection, Registration Details, Review, and Confirmation.

Implement multiple design variations and a way to preview/switch them in the UI: (1) at least one dark-only theme and (2) at least one theme that demonstrates color theory (intentional complementary/analogous palette) while keeping the layout concise, straight to the point, and sleek.

Design the exam registration form UI with realistic fields and client-side validation only (no persistence): student name, student ID, email, exam selection, date/time (or session), accommodations (optional), and agreement checkbox; include clear inline validation and a disabled/enabled submit state.

Provide a coherent, distinct visual direction for the app (layout grid, typography scale, spacing system, and component hierarchy) and apply it consistently across all screens, avoiding overly decorative elements.
Ensure the UI is responsive and accessible for a draft: usable on mobile and desktop, keyboard navigable for core flow, and with sufficient contrast in each theme variant.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create front-end draft UI for a student exam registration website (no backend), concise and sleek, with multiple design variations including dark-only themes and color-theory-based themes.
